reviews.review_text: My only complaint was the cost a year ago. this item cost half again as much as it does now otherwise it's easy to set up. looks to be quite dependable as most most Western digital items are

reviews.title: Defective, replacement defective too
reviews.review_text: Western Digital My Book 12TB external drive would not display in Windows 10 file manager. Ran Western Digital diagnostics and got "SMART status failure". Return unit and purchased another which came with box previously opened. This one did at least have a driver loaded, but still would not display and got "SMART status failure" when running WD diagnostics. I own another WD 12TB drive that has worked fine for years.

reviews.title: Run from this!
reviews.review_text: Run from this. Regrettably, I bought this one and another 16tb drive because I have the WD Pro and they worked fine. Needed an external usb and bought this brand for the 16tb and 12tb. It has been less than a year and both began making the dreaded click of death!!!! Neither have been replaced yet even though still under warranty. I will never buy WD drives again including the WD Pro (-seriously how would you feel)?

When I got home I noticed the box had already been opened(the seals were broken). I still hooked it to my computer but the hard drive was bad, it was pretty obvious because of the loud ticking noise coming from the disc drive inside enclosure. I had to return to store with hard drive, apparently exchanges are not a thing any more and had to go threw this huge ordeal.

reviews.title: Arrived on time as ordered.
reviews.review_text: Arrived not working. States "fatal hardware error", after troubleshooting the hard drive is bad. All connections, the cables etc are good and the computer based on trying multiple ports.

reviews.title: selling 3 year old computer equipment as new
reviews.review_text: When I registered the product with Western Digital, they told me this device was made in Mar 1 2022. My purchase was Mar 15, 2025. They wont honor any warranty until Walmart can prove I was sold a new device and not a used/refurb devise. What a crooked way to do business by selling 3 year old Computer Devices as new. Ever heard of Moores Law? Did you know the generation cycle is normally about 6 months? That would make this drive a Great Great Grandfather. You have shattered my belief and trust I've had in quality of items I get from Walmart

reviews.title: Incompatible with WD Smartware!!!!!
reviews.review_text: I was not informed by sales literature or WD website that this drive (part of the new series of drives) is not compatible with WD Smartware Backup software until I looked very deep into their website.. The replacement software (My Backup) will not install on any of my 5 computer systems. It sucks.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.review_text: This USB hard drive is by far the worst one I've ever earned. Every time you try to open a file or you try to save a file it "thinks" for a very long time. It takes so much time to open or close file or just navigating through the folders.

reviews.title: Short life. Won't buy WD again.
reviews.review_text: Hard drive was great while it worked. Failed a little over a year in. I have multiple hard drives that are pushing 10 years of age. It's a rare occurence for me to have one fail, much less so soon. I won't be purchasing this brand again.

would have gotten a better review but the cord that connect the hdd to whatever you are using it with was messed up when i got it and they wouldnt replace it somi.had to buy another one. was only 11 bucks but still....not the point.
Apps would not get installed on windows 10 PC. Upon connecting it to PC, it would not start and PC froze. I returned it the next day. It seems that the hard drive was damaged.

reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Time
reviews.review_text: When connected to any USB port on front or back of Windows desktop computer, device was recognized by computer, but not by explorer, and therefore it could not be initialized. WIndows reported that most current driver was installed, and that device was working properly. This definitely was not true. I wasted an entire day troubleshooting this item.

reviews.title: 14tb My Book
reviews.review_text: Ok so far?? Time will tell?? Very sad that Western Digital thinks it is unnecessary for a power/active blue LED Light like in the older harddrive??? Don't know it is functioning unless you access from "My PC"?? My old 640Gb had worked great for 18 years. Usb cord is very short?? 3 foot?? How cheap! At least a 6 foot would be acceptable?? Cant even place My Book on desktop?? Won't reach pc tower under desk!! Why??

reviews.title: poor quality, bad experience, returned
reviews.review_text: the software (.exe file) shipped on drive did not load. The downloaded version had issues. Once I got software up and run the drive made a "clunking" noise every 4 to 5 secs and this was at idle not read or write. Called CS they said this was not normal and to return.

reviews.title: Great hardware, poor software
reviews.review_text: As usual with WD drives, the hardware is solid. I just hate the archaic lock software on PC. You have no easy way to toggle different computers to auto unlock without password. It's been YEARS and still doesn't work right. You have to remove the password and can only autounlock 1 computer, usually. It should be a simple toggle after typing in the password, and then possible ask for the password again or some second measure per computer. The software needs to be updated. I NEVER buy a WD drive without hardware encryption, but the software behind it lacks, always. WD, HIRE some good people to refresh this and make more options and make it user friendly.

reviews.title: Do not buy. Failed within a week.
reviews.review_text: The drive began failing within a week. Not recognized by any system unless forced to mount, endlessly clicking the hours to its demise.

reviews.title: DOA
reviews.review_text: DOA. Brand spankin new. The computer would see it but when I tried to initialize it it would say fatal hardware error.

reviews.title: What a shame
reviews.review_text: Not sure How this happened but, i bought this hard drive for school and for future work. It didn't work at all. My mac could not find it and my windows was able to find it but the hard drive was corrupted. Could not use it at all.

reviews.title: NEVER RECIEVED THE ITEM, SENT TO THE WRONG HOUSE.
reviews.review_text: My reason for giving this item a poor rating is because I never received it during that following date whomever delivered it brought it to the wrong house, the only good thing came out of all of this is I contacted customer service, hopefully things will get better.

reviews.title: WD 18TB My Book Desktop - Very Noisy
reviews.review_text: Have had good experiences with WD products in the past. This one is very noisy and constantly making a clicking noise which is very distracting. Not sure if this is normal. I'm concerned that the unit is not functioning properly and will eventually fail when it is out of warranty. Somewhat disappointed with this purchase.

reviews.title: MyBook 4TB external hard driver
reviews.review_text: Bought to replace my older (12+ year old) external hard drive. It finally quit.

reviews.title: I used this hard drive once, then it stopped worki
reviews.review_text: I used this hard drive once, then it stopped working.

reviews.title: 8 Tb WD Hard drive
reviews.review_text: WD Hard drive trash didn't work upon arrival
Price was cheaper than other retailers, but WD quality is only middling as similar drive has failed.

reviews.title: Dead upon opening.
reviews.review_text: The external drive did not work; tried multiple outlets to confirm it was not a power issue. Packed it back up and returned it.

reviews.title: Works, but missing the activity light
reviews.review_text: It works, but I really miss the activity light on my other external drives that Western Digital used to put on the My Book drives. My other complaint is that the utilities that came with it are not backward compatable with my old My Book drives and made them inoperable.

reviews.title: Didn't Last more than 3 months.
reviews.review_text: This was for my business, and it worked GREAT until it didn't. that time period was shocking considering it's a WD HDD. it lasted until August 20th, 2021. 3 months is NOT acceptable for the cost I paid. I'm just relieved I (as always) bought the extra warranty Walmart offers.

reviews.title: Connectivity
reviews.review_text: Does not connect to home network. I received a link from WD saying the new drives replace my older mybook and they gave an incentive to purchase. This on was one of the recommended drives. Once I received, I realized there was no way to connect it to my home network. So it is a paperweight.

reviews.title: Works But Loud
reviews.review_text: My second unit after the first no longer worked with my Apple operating system. Used the first now and then with Time Machine and it worked fine. Haven't used the second yet. Only down side is the noise the second makes sitting on my desk which "microphones" the sound. Had to bungee cord it to a slab of cork and then set the slab on an air cushion to dampen the WD unit's loud vibes.

reviews.title: Damaged
reviews.review_text: When I first hooked this up it had a really bad vibration and was super loud when reading/writing files. Also had like a bad rhythmic vibration that you can hear and feel just by touching my desk it was on. Few days later it stopped showing up in my files. I had to unplug and plug in the power every now and then for it to show up. So now I am re-transferring my data to the old drive and replacing this with another brand.

reviews.title: Cheap unit but stays warm which may fail soon
reviews.review_text: Typical WD My book that was nicely priced. What was weird was the funky 2 combined connector... Not sure if this is the new standard USB 3 connector but this was the first time that I see this.... I use this as a backup device and it still stay warm even when it is not backing up. The server that I am backing is configured to turn off the usb interface when not in use. I am not sure if My Book power management is working. May need to switch to a NAS backup if the unit fails prematurely from overheating. Another setup issue that I did not like - I needed to format the unit before using. Would have preferred to have the unit pre-formatted.

reviews.title: Damaged
reviews.review_text: Not only is this product not from Walmart it could come potentially damaged or with the wrong size internal HD . Mine stated it was 6 or 8 TB and it never held the data. What does a normal person do when that happens? You return it. Lo %26 behold WD states it's the wrong HD and charged me anyways! AVOID

reviews.title: Noisy
reviews.review_text: This is loud - not sure I can keep something so loud in my office

reviews.title: Probably a great product just not for me.
reviews.review_text: No instructions included. Have to download and it was too difficult for a novice.

reviews.title: Outlet adapter does not work
reviews.review_text: Purchased a refurbished MyBook came with several outlet adapters, the American didn’t want to charge the MyBook device. So I’m not able to use my use it.

reviews.title: Not worth Risk
reviews.review_text: Product failed after 2 weeks. I could not get it to power on. After a couple of days, I tried again and it powered on. Not worth taking the risk, I sent device back for refund.

reviews.title: Disappointed, it was not what I asked for
reviews.review_text: I called Western Digital and asked for a HD compatible with my Tivo Edge and was told this My Book was what I needed. I have yet to get it to work with the Tivo

reviews.title: Setting up My Book
reviews.review_text: Getting My Book set up with Acronis True Image was challenging. Had to send three emails to Western Digital tech support to work it out. The user manual is not written for True Image software.

reviews.title: Stick to retailers
reviews.review_text: Great when I get one that is not dead in a day. And your warranty and returns group "needs work" to say the least. I love your products, just not through you.

reviews.title: Maybe there is a better brand.
reviews.review_text: It worked until it did not. Failed about a month after the end of the warranty. I bought another one just because I was too busy to find a better one.

reviews.title: Fast, reliable so far, super noisy.
reviews.review_text: Fast and reliable so far, but loud! The initial spin up sounds like a woodpecker is rattling my desk! Bought three of these and all of them are the same, loud aggressive noise.

reviews.title: Good value but LOUD
reviews.review_text: It is incredibly loud and vibrates my desk making me think my phone is ringing. Other reviews have stated the same but it still concerns me that it sounds like it's dying right out of the box.

reviews.title: Problems with the drive I received (12 TB My Book)
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately the drive I received here is a bum. From day one, it made loud grinding noises. My other drives do not make these noises. When I checked the drive, it didn't show errors so I checked the cords with alternatives I knew to be working well. The noise was not consistent so I attempted to load files. The files wouldn't show correctly as if they weren't loading onto the drive. When I closed the folder and reopened, they were there. This is also not normal behavior. I also noticed intermittent behaviors were the drive would load much slower than the rest (including another 12 tb with matching files). Sometimes taking 15-20 minutes (I'd give up on it loading and go do something else only to come back and it's loaded). It has caused disk utility to crash and I haven't had that happen before. DU only crashes or loads very slowly when this drive is connected. Sometimes the drive doesn't connect at all. I reached out for support but will likely have to exchange under warranty. I feel there is something not right and I have numerous WD EHD's, this one is not behaving normally. I have a concern of being forced into a refurbished option but my drive is only 2.5 months old and has had this problem since day one. I wish I'd gone with my gut for the exchange before the first 30 days. I am also concerned I will now have additional shipping costs despite that this drive was sent to me like this.

reviews.title: FAKE DRIVES - Do Not Purchase!!!
reviews.review_text: BEWARE!!!! There is someone pulling the larger drives from these enclosures and replacing them with smaller or dead completely dead drives. Looked in mine because it was DOA and found a Hitachi 500GB dead drive in place of what should have been a WD 8TB drive.

reviews.title: Can't use!
reviews.review_text: Ordered to have on hand for future use after finishing and feeling better from cancer treatments and surgies. Opened today and it has the incorrect USB cord. The cord and adapter packaging look like they had been part of a return though box look new and unopened. Because it's outside of the return deadline (my fault) I now have an expensive paper weight.

reviews.title: Terrible.
reviews.review_text: Very disappointed went from a cheap $30 2tb that would reserve space for a 50gb game within a minute meanwhile this $90 4tb drive took nearly half an hour to accomplish the same thing. Huge waste of money wouldn't recommend for anything beyond pictures or small documents.

reviews.title: Very Poor Drive, failed
reviews.review_text: Documentation was very poor, it just contained a load of legal garbage, no instructions on how to set up the drive or transfer files. I found thru Google to use Acronis True Image WD Edition which was a free download. This did not work correctly and formatted the drive incorrectly so I had to reformat the drive thru Windows. I found a free program named Macrium Reflect which worked well to transfer my files. I then started having problems with the drive so I ran the drive tests in the western Digital software and it failed so I now knew the drive was bad. During this time I contacted Western Digital several times and they were not much help and would not give me a refund. I returned the drive to Walmart for a refund and ordered a Toshiba.

reviews.title: Not very happy
reviews.review_text: The hard drive is an Xmas gift, so I won't know how the recipient likes it till then. I'm not happy with FedEx, though. The box was left in plain sight in the middle of the front edge of my porch with no attempt to hide it. The driver did not ring the doorbell. It was not packaged well and rattled around inside the shipping box. One corner of the original box was somewhat crunched, so I took photos and opened the box to see if the hard drive looked damaged. It appears OK. The shipping box did not appear to be damaged, so I assumed the original box was damaged when it was put in the shipping box.

reviews.title: Do not buy
reviews.review_text: RIP off! i purchased this tried to get it replaced they as in the "manufacture warranty" Western Ditgail ( RMA team) told me that I had tampered with it. and they refuse to return it. I called to store manager I was told they will help me BUT. since I am being ripped off my hardworking money. I am without it. do not buy any WD drives. they set up for you to update to go to thier web site . it never worked with my computer. I could not find the file to transfer my files. I just wanted to have a large extrenal storage to save my photo and documents. do not buy this . I want to give this zero stars so I give it 5 poops.

reviews.title: would not work went with seagate
reviews.review_text: tried 3 of these locally and had to return them all, none worked, would not mount to the desk top

reviews.title: dead
reviews.review_text: this hard drive was dead out of the box. no way to initialize. tried two other cables

reviews.title: Not for editing
reviews.review_text: OK for straight archiving, not for editing because it has to be 'woken up' constantly.

reviews.title: Second non working external drive I've purchased!
reviews.review_text: Pauses and won't continue downloading...

reviews.title: Do not purchase if you want to keep it plugged in.
reviews.review_text: I do not like this drive. I have to unplug it all the time. If it is plugged in my computer will not boot up.

reviews.title: Connection issues.
reviews.review_text: works great, but it takes about 5 or so tries to connect each time. inhave to unplug and plug back in over and over tonget the connection to work.
I returned it because it required an electrical outlet, not because it was a poor product. With the store credit I will continue shopping at Walmart.

reviews.title: Bait and switch
reviews.review_text: Not a replacement for MyCloud device that's not being updated for security. Bait and switch, I got the raw deal
Product was broken upon arrival. The price was fair, although I expected slightly cheaper discount from Walmart.

reviews.title: No indicator light
reviews.review_text: Very good hardware and software. My only complaint is that there is no indicator light that shows the unit on and functioning.

reviews.title: Product was clearly used
reviews.review_text: Plastic was scratched and had broken plastic. Clearly seen heavy use. Extremely unsafe to sell USED computer hardware like this. Could've easily been contained virus' to steal my bank data.

reviews.title: Ridiculously slow, maybe broken, no repair app?
reviews.review_text: Windows first told me there were errors.A couple of days later, WD Utilities App too. I can see my files but the quck and complete tests are failing. I bough the My Vook 8TB 6 months ago, and has been sitting on my desk since then. Now what? There is no repair app? You can run diagnostics but what for, besides to jump ship and throw it out?

reviews.title: Something sounds bad.
reviews.review_text: Makes a strange clicking sound all the time. If you lay it on either side it stops. ???

reviews.title: The worst HD in the world.
reviews.review_text: Never never never never never never never buy this useless HD.

reviews.title: My experience with My Book 12 T Storage
reviews.review_text: Slow... Less then 12T by 1fill terabyte. No light show you that it is on or off.

reviews.title: disappontingly slow
reviews.review_text: very slow transfer rate. 32GB after two days. then transfer stopped entirely.
I didn't like nothing about it it didn't work for me.

reviews.title: Wrongly advertised as compatible with new XBOX S
reviews.review_text: WD are great but this model did not work with my New Xbox S hence returned

reviews.title: Won't work with Playstation 4 or pro
reviews.review_text: Wouldn't detect. The one time it did a error popped up.

reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.review_text: Arrived with damaged head. Not working.

reviews.title: Crap, Crap, Crap!!!
reviews.review_text: Absolute piece of crap. I have now bought 2 of these. Neither would initialize. Tried on 3 different computers. I have never had a good Wedtern Digital hard drive. I won't try this brand ever again. I have 5 Seagate external drives and 4 internal. Never had a single problem with any. Seagate is the brand to buy.

reviews.title: Will NOT buy again. ALLSTATE warranty site is FAKE
reviews.review_text: DEAD the day before the two year warranty I purchased expires. (THREE year mfg limited warranty) ALLSTATE IS BOGUS, no matter how many times you change your password, it never matches for me to put in a claim on a Saturday when the warranty expires SUNDAY.

reviews.title: Couldn’t even turn it on
reviews.review_text: The ports for the USB and the power cord were both either missing or recessed on this unit. How does quality control get this bad on items that have been manufactured by the most well known manufacturer for decades?

reviews.title: Crap external hard drive
reviews.review_text: I lost ALL my data. I’m a photographer and lost everything. And the company won’t refund me. Do NOT buy this. You will lose all your information when it crashes.

reviews.title: Worst Product for the price!!!
reviews.review_text: Do not buy this . After a year it will randomly go out. I am having a constant issue with this crappy drive disconnecting and connecting. Save your money.

reviews.title: 8 TB mybook
reviews.review_text: 2nd drive purchased, both crashed in less than a year. The latest purchased in july 2019 only used backup storage was only actually connected to my computer 4 or 5 times and now dead no power. Stay away from this drive a thumb drive is safer

reviews.title: DOA X2. Returning.
reviews.review_text: Unreliable. Purchased 2 of these drives. Both recognized as zero GB and would not initialize when plugged in. WD utility says there is a 'fatal hardware error." Wasted a lot of my time.

reviews.title: Important movies / files now the drive won't Boot
reviews.review_text: Purchased this hard drive October 21, 2023 after a couple of months couldn't get it to boot up, even after removing the drive from the case, And put some very important files and movies on this drive,

reviews.title: Extremely underwhelming...
reviews.review_text: I cannot fathom why anyone would make a USB 3.0 device, then cram a junk 5400rpm drive in it...but here it is. This thing is SO slow. I bought the 18TB model, and actually filled it almost completely up with backup data....only took several days to do so, which is not acceptable for me. This drive is also extremely noisy, and sounds like it is grinding, so it will be for backup only, and not ever hold any critical information. I only bought this drive because it was inexpensive, but I should have known better, so that's on me. On another note, this thing is not compatible with Roku, which only decreases its usefulness that much more. Also runs considerably warmer than my other drives from another vendor...

reviews.title: Damage items
reviews.review_text: I received a leaking gallon of milk on my porch and my other item was submerged.

reviews.title: Fake garbage
reviews.review_text: The thing isnt even a real storage device, its just a piece of plastic.

reviews.title: doa garbage
reviews.review_text: garbage. should have read reviews. makes a clicking sound out of the box and stopped working in ten minutes entirely. AVOID!
2nd of these to not work out of the box. Have a 3rd that works fine. However Other reviews with same problem too so they have a reliability problem.

reviews.title: HD and Power Supply Too Awkward for Desk
reviews.review_text: The Hard Drive was too large for my desk and the power supply was awkward. I bought the WD easystore instead because it is smaller and does not require a power supply.

reviews.title: Good drive. Not so good connection
reviews.review_text: They tell you on the website that it is not recommended to use a hub to connect the drive. Well guess what? MacBook Pro has NO USB-A PORTS! So what to do... what to do... Buy a Micro USB to USB C cable. And violà!!! It works and seems even faster than the inferior cable they provide. Shame on you WD! You should provide that with your drive. Or reimburse me. LOL

reviews.title: 12 Tb version slow, 42 MB/s with USB 3.2
reviews.review_text: I saw a review for the 4 Tb version that showed test results of 170 MB/s. That was a buying point for me, but when I bought the 12 Tb version I am getting a top write speed of 42 MB/s even with USB 3.2 port. That is actually slower than my old portable hard drive.

reviews.title: Stopped working under 3 years
reviews.review_text: Reading the reviews, I seem to have a similar experience as Samantha. My WD 4TB Book has simply stopped backing up. Because it is loud, I can hear it go on and off, mainly staying off. Tried to triage, but nothing as worked. Although this is under three years, when I check my profile online, it says out of warranty, even though I had it registered. It was easy to use and worked well ... when it worked. But to only last less than three years is not ideal.

reviews.title: sucks
reviews.review_text: very hard time mounting! huge drive with all my files and so sensitive! Constantly afraid I will lose EVERYTHING! Not even close to filling this drive! A very hard time mounting!!! I hate this piece of crap!!! Wish I had read product reviews before purchasing!!

reviews.title: Go for a better drive
reviews.review_text: This drive is faulty and not reliable AT ALL. Buy only if you plan to use it for non important things. Things you would not need in the future and don't care about. This drive WILL stop working on you. RANDOMLY. I only use this drive when I am in office. It sits on my desk. I am in a IT secured room where there is all sorts of IT equipment. Some how my drive just doesn't work at all. Randomly it will turn on other times it won't.. I DO NOT RECCOMMEND THIS DRIVE AT ALL!!

reviews.title: Disc has stoped to working!!
reviews.review_text: Lost all of my data in just a minute. Disc just stoped working, doesn't load any data and make some weird sound. Since I buy this it was only on my table, never fall down or something. Horrible experience!!!!!!! I just hope they can recover my data somewhere. Anyway will I need to pay a lot of money for this service.

reviews.title: Big letdown
reviews.review_text: I bought my first my notebook 4 TB in 2015 after 5 years of use it shorted out , at the time I still had most of my Data on My home PC and the my notebook was my backup so no big deal I just went and bought 2 more in 20 17 in 20 20 one of my new ones shorted out and now I just lost the 3rd one I'm very disappointed with western Digital

reviews.title: Junk, DOA Out of the box
reviews.review_text: Purchased this. Unpacked and followed all the directions to the "T". Device is DOA out of the b ok. Will not power up. Cannot do a thing with it. Had to go to the local store to bail myself. Called customer servce, on hold for 33 minutes before I just hung up. Never aga ok n!!!

reviews.title: Beware of WD Products! had issues with 3 different
reviews.review_text: What is the deal with WD products, currently I am having issues with 3 different of their products at once??!! My WDBFJK004OHBK My WD My Book hard drive is not working correctly, I was in the middle of downloading some files and shut my computer down to run errands and when I came back to finish the files my My Book was no longer showing up in my file explorer, it does show up under the section where it says eject item, it shows up in the drives manager but not the other manager. The hard drive is running, and light shows from the inside.( I ran the WD digital Data Life guard Diagnostics Tool and it shows the my book but says not available)As I said it was working perfectly and my errands took less than 30 minutes when it stopped showing in the file explorer anymore. The more I look into wd hard drives the more I find that thier products have a lot of issues that I did not know about when I looked into the research originally. I tried everything that was suggested. I plugged the hardrive directly into the wall, I shut down the computer a couple of times, I went in and unistalled the my book drive under all the areas you could do that and reinstalled nothing worked!!! this is ridulous how can their products have so many issues this one does not make sense. it was working and than it wasnt and I can not get to my files that I was back up which is the whole point of these products how is wd sitll in business seriously!? Issue 2 I plugged in my passport 2tb external hard drive that was working perfectly and has thousands of vids and other files on it into my WD live Media player to watch something off it and it played for a second (3 issues) but the purple screen that often happens with the WD media showed up again the files played fine but when I was done unplugging the hdmi cable it would not show the files on the screen anymore and now when I plug the passport in my computer to check it it will not show up on my File explorer or the drive file at all now!! This is Crap WD all of this has happened in just the past 3 days in the middle of another Covid shutdown, again how is this company still in business I now have several thousand files, and movies and things that I can now now find or retrieve or whatever!!!?? and these were my backups I only have some of what was on my My Book hardrive that is back uped on another hardrive but some of the best stuff was on this passport that suddenly stopped working or something??!Q!

reviews.title: RUN don't walk away from this
reviews.review_text: Used this for a backup. Lighting blew my computer so I reinstalled files from this. EVERY SINGLE FILE IS CORRUPT!

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.review_text: Don't purchase this - mine came locked and now they won't return it. I bought a $200 brick basically. Thanks Walmart!

reviews.title: Unstable. Needs external shock absorber
reviews.review_text: Fast and easily connected. Serious problem: easily knocked over when standing vertically. There should be vents on the sides too. The drive should come with an external shock absorber las in the Rugged series.

reviews.title: Unreliable as data backup
reviews.review_text: After only 4 months, the drive failed and after running the windows 'scan and repair' it lost all the data. Data backup is it's whole job so I would have been better off not having this. Sorely disappointed and frustrated with everything I lost.

reviews.title: Regret I bought this
reviews.review_text: All I wanted was a simple USB drive that I could attach to a NAS or any PC. Instead I ended up with a drive that requires special drivers on my Windows 11 PC and is not recognized by my NAS. No other USB drive that I own has these issues

reviews.title: Failed right out of the Box.
reviews.review_text: Brand New out of the Box and FAILED to work at all! I have another just like it that I've had for 2 months and so far, it's working for now. 50% Fail rate is only worth 1 star!

reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
reviews.review_text: Yes the negative reviews are correct, DO NOT BUY. I used it twice, and when trying to access my data, the thing isnt working. It doesnt open in my computer, it doesnt allow me to do anything nor access my data, now I have to go pay a third party company to recover my data.

reviews.title: Kaput after 6 mos.
reviews.review_text: Stopped working after 6 months. At least my previous WD My Book managed to last 2 months over the warranty. Really sucks to lose data. Apparently WD builds these cheaply so there are less backup mechanisms and you're more prone to get your data wiped. I'm done with WD, sticking with Toshiba they have yet to fail me.

reviews.title: Very disappointed with My Book
reviews.review_text: This My Book was not "plug and play". Once out of the box, it took me about 30 minutes to get it to appear in Desk Utility, which made me suspicious, but I went ahead and began saving my files to it. I ejected it but have now spent several days trying to get it to reappear in Desk Utility which I have not been able to do. So basically all my files are on an external hard drive that I can't open to delete the files so I can return it. Don't buy this. There's nothing convenient or efficient about it.

reviews.title: Not reliable
reviews.review_text: Bought 3 of these a few years ago and two of them have failed. Bye-bye photos

reviews.title: No documentation anywhere, only how to buy
reviews.review_text: Where is the Quickstart Guide or any other documentation on how to use or set up WD My Book WDBBGB0040HBK-NESN

reviews.title: Insanely faulty
reviews.review_text: Bought the unit, wouldn't even power up, returned it and the second unit I received was ALSO DOA, how is this even possible?

reviews.title: Highly dissatisfied
reviews.review_text: cannot access this drive . I don't know if this particular one is bad or what. I am going to be returning it.
The device would not turn on. After attempting multiple times, realized I have a defected device. I was not able to return it to WalMart because it was pass the allowed time.

reviews.title: Doesn't work with current Mac OS
reviews.review_text: Drive was NOT COMPATIBLE with Mac running OS Catalina 10.15.1; returned.
